Management.name: Melissa Mitchell
Management.description: I am a final year PhD student in electrical engineering, and I joined the team in 2022. I am now the technical lead, overseeing the sensors, hardware, and software teams. My role has taken me to Latvia and South Africa, and seeing the team grow and the device develop has been an incredible experience.

Management.name: Alexz Farrall
Management.description: I am an EngD HCI Research Engineer with an Electronics and Communication Engineering background. I focus on innovations in healthcare , working directly with stakeholders to optimise delivery. Having belonged to Biodevices without Borders as a student for many years, I now enjoy supporting the team in their vision.

Management.name: Vrinda Raninga
Management.description: I am a 3rd year student studying Chemical Engineering who has been a part of Bath Biodevices without Borders (and its iterations) since my first year. I have thoroughly enjoyed watching the team grow to what it is today and am excited for it to continue when I leave too.

Hardware.name: George Madeley
Hardware.description: As a passionate software developer, I delve into the realms of full-stack web development, machine learning, and game development. You’ll often find me immersed in learning new programming languages, meticulously documenting code, or contributing to exciting new projects.

Hardware.name: Tabitha Hirst
Hardware.description: I am a second year Computer Systems student and I love both hardware and software. I also enjoy product design and film. Hopefully I'll be back in 2025 after my placement year!

Hardware.name: Harry Kneale Roby
Hardware.description: I am a 5th year student studying Computer Systems Engineering (MEng). I specialise in RTL hardware design for FPGAs, embedded programming and PCB design.

Hardware.name: Alex Marshall
Hardware.description: 4th year CSE master's student with an interest in embedded systems, firmware and programmable logic

Hardware.name: Tony Pow
Hardware.description: I’m a final year EEE student and initially worked with BWB through the GDBP last year on the desalination project. I joined officially this year and I’m interested developing the hardware of the Oasis device into something representative of the final product.

Hardware.name: Daanish Ansari
Hardware.description: I am a second year Mechanical Engineering student passionate about creating impactful solutions and excited to contribute to Bath Biodevices without Borders in driving innovative progress.

Hardware.name: Frieden Rawding
Hardware.description: I'm a final year CSE student who just joined the team this semester. I'm especially interested in PCB design and I'm excited to work on hardware to help make a difference.

Sensors.name: Daniel Light
Sensors.description: Possesses experience in programming, circuit design, and finance management. As Head of Finance, created a finance spreadsheet for the team, implemented an autonomous notification system to aid future cohorts in finding and applying for grants, and supported team members throughout the course of the year.

Sensors.name: Jordan Dawson
Sensors.description: One of the founding members and current Head of Sensors for Biodevices Without Borders. Led development on all the sensors currently under development with a focus on pH sensors.

Sensors.name: Alexa Mesham
Sensors.description: I am a third year chemical engineering student and have been a member of the team since my second year. As a South African, this project is close to my heart and I have loved playing a part in its progress.

Sensors.name: Olivia Smith
Sensors.description: I’m a biology student who enjoys microbiology, climbing, occasionally running and trying to make sense of what these engineers say in the weekly meetings.

Sensors.name: Helena Woodvine
Sensors.description: Being a highly motivated and inquisitive individual I am hugely enjoying contributing towards Biodevices without Borders' applied learning project. Eager to pursue a Biotechnology-orientated career addressing UN STGs, aiding in the development and testing of electrochemical sensors for different water safety parameters is incredibly insightful. Further fuelling my interest in diagnostic lab-on-chip biosensing technology, I'm integrated across teams to have a comprehensive understanding of the processes involved to allow the development of these devices.

Sensors.name: Tara Mckenna
Sensors.course: MEng Integrated Mechanical and Electrical Engineering
Sensors.description: A member of the Sensors team, working primarily on pH sensing.

Sensors.name: Alex Hadjiev
Sensors.description: I am a 1st year student studying Electrical and Electronic Engineering who has joined Bath Biodevices without Borders this year. I am looking forward to witnessing the team's innovation and creativity throughout the year.

Sensors.name: Vivien Shkodra
Sensors.description: I am a second year Biomedical Sciences student who is also on her second year working for the Biodevices without Borders project. I enjoy working towards an initiative which aims to positively impact our life on Earth and provide basic resource equality such as water.

Sensors.name: Cordelia Liu
Sensors.description: Hello! I am a new member of Bath Biodevices without Borders, currently in my second year of Chemical Engineering. Passionate about using bioengineering to tackle global challenges such as water scarcity, I look forward to contributing to our team’s mission. Following on from my passion in bioengineering, I am eager to deepen my expertise by applying theoretical knowledge to practical, impactful solutions through this project.

Sensors.name: Mari Mcphail
Sensors.description: I am a second-year Biological Sciences student and recently became a member of Bath Biodevices without Borders. Being part of the team has been an incredibly enjoyable and rewarding experience.

Sensors.name: Toni Adenipekun
Sensors.course: MEng Integrated Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (IMEE)
Sensors.description: I’m a 3rd year IMEE student returning from placement. I enjoy mixing software, electrical, and mechanical engineering together to create new ideas. This is my first year as a part of the Biodevices team

Software.name: George Madeley
Software.description: As a passionate software developer, I delve into the realms of full-stack web development, machine learning, and game development. You’ll often find me immersed in learning new programming languages, meticulously documenting code, or contributing to exciting new projects.

Software.name: Tabitha Hirst
Software.description: I am a second year Computer Systems student and I love both hardware and software. I also enjoy product design and film. Hopefully I'll be back in 2025 after my placement year!

Software.name: Jamie Diamand
Software.description: I'm from Brighton, I enjoy playing piano and looking after my cat. I lead the software team.

Software.name: Tom Henderson
Software.description: I am a second year Mathematics student who loves to play sports and create exciting things. When home I enjoy travelling and spending time with my dogs.

Software.name: Anjleen Devgun
Software.description: I am a second year EEE student who is interested in a career in cyber security.

Software.name: Isabelle Whittle
Software.description: I am a 2nd year Mathematics student and have recently joined Bath Biodevices without Borders. I am excited to get involved with the project and learn in a welcoming team environment!

Software.name: Alex Hadjiev
Software.description: I am a 1st year student studying Electrical and Electronic Engineering who has joined Bath Biodevices without Borders this year. I am looking forward to witnessing the team's innovation and creativity throughout the year.

Software.name: Euan Hanna
Software.description: I am a 2nd second year physics student studying physics at the university of Bath where I recently joined the Biodevices without Borders team. I have enjoyed work with the team to develop the project and hope to be involved as it continues to develop

Software.name: Toni Adenipekun
Software.course: MEng Integrated Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (IMEE)
Software.description: I’m a 3rd year IMEE student returning from placement. I enjoy mixing software, electrical, and mechanical engineering together to create new ideas. This is my first year as a part of the Biodevices team
